p: For both species SLA was maximal under FA conditions at 20 °C which was significantly higher for the fast-growing B. hordeaceus (p = 0.016; df = 8; t = 2.58; Fig. 1b). B. hordeaceus had a similar SLA at 7 °C and 30 °C, which was about 55% of the maximum. The slow-growing B. erectus showed a similar pattern, but SLA was much more reduced at 7 °C than at 30 °C, 36% versus 87% of maximum (Table 1).
